channel.title: NASA on my undergrad work
channel.description: Recent content in NASA on my undergrad work

item.title: My project at NASA
item.description:
My work revolves around Electrically Detected Magnetic Resonance (EDMR). It’s a method of detecting small magnetic fields electrically. In principle it’s very simple.

Say we have a semiconductor, like silicon carbide. This semiconductor, made by nature or in a lab, is never perfect. There may exist some missing atoms, or extra atoms, deep in its molecular structure. These defects provide some extra electrons, or extra holes, which can be used for quantum sensing. In EDMR, they are used to measure magnetic fields electrically. I’ll now walkthrough how this is done in silicon carbide (4H-SiC) specifically.
